content.question: ​The rational function <math alttext="r"><mi>r</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="r open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator open parentheses 2 x minus 3 close parentheses open parentheses x minus 4 close parentheses open parentheses x minus 2 close parentheses over denominator open parentheses 3 x minus 1 close parentheses open parentheses 2 x plus 1 close parentheses open parentheses x minus 1 close parentheses end fraction"><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfrac></math> and is equivalent to <math alttext="r open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator p open parentheses x close parentheses over denominator q open parentheses x close parentheses end fraction"><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>p</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mi>q</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfrac></math>, where <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math> and <math alttext="q"><mi>q</mi></math> are polynomial functions. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: ​The degree of <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math> is less than the degree of <math alttext="q"><mi>q</mi></math>, and <math alttext="limit as x rightwards arrow infinity of r open parentheses x close parentheses equals 0"><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>.

​The degree of <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math> is greater than the degree of <math alttext="q"><mi>q</mi></math>, and <math alttext="limit as x rightwards arrow infinity of r open parentheses x close parentheses equals infinity"><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>∞</mo></math>.

​The degree of <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math> is equal to the degree of <math alttext="q"><mi>q</mi></math>, and <math alttext="limit as x rightwards arrow infinity of r open parentheses x close parentheses equals 0"><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>.

​The degree of <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math> is equal to the degree of <math alttext="q"><mi>q</mi></math>, and <math alttext="limit as x rightwards arrow infinity of r open parentheses x close parentheses equals 1 third"><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math>.

content.answer: ​The degree of <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math> is equal to the degree of <math alttext="q"><mi>q</mi></math>, and <math alttext="limit as x rightwards arrow infinity of r open parentheses x close parentheses equals 1 third"><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>r</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
